p: We screened hospitalized patients positive for influenza virus RNA at the microbiology labs of five tertiary hospitals in China from 1 January 2013 to 31 May 2019 (Additional file 1). Patients with laboratory-confirmed Flu-p were included. Exclusion criteria were as follows: (i) Aged ≤ 14 years; (ii) not classified as community-onset pneumonia (pneumonia onset ≥ 48 h post-admission and hospitalized within the last 28 days [ 13]), as it was difficult to determine whether nosocomial pneumonia occurred after the onset the influenza; (iii) it has been reported that the clinical characteristics and outcomes of immunocompromised patients with influenza differ to those of immunocompetent hosts. So, those who are immunocompromised were excluded [ 14].
